oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Band-steaming reduces laborious hand-weeding in vegetables
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Melander, Bo
Jørgensen, Martin H.
Elsgaard, Lars
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Weed management
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Band-steaming is a new method that may reduce the need for hand-weeding in demanding row crops like carrot and drilled onion. Band-steaming only affects a soil volume equal to the intra-row area of the subsequent crop, and effectively kills the weed seeds in this soil volume. Side-effects on beneficial soil organisms are minimized as compared to current steaming technology, but still need to be assessed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Melander, Bo; Jørgensen, Martin H. and Elsgaard, Lars (2004) Band-steaming reduces laborious hand-weeding in vegetables. DARCOFenews (3).
